CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 3, 1951, pg. 6, reads: "King Dethroned - King Count Frank, center, 27-year-old Hill District man and thirteen time arrested dope addict who was found unconscious in the bathroom of a Hill District flat recently from the effects of a self-administered shot of dope, consisting of a mixture of morphine, codeine, opium, and 'some kind of hydrochloride powder (probably cocaine),' is being questioned by Inspector Lawrence J. Maloney, right, and Patrolman A. Palmer, left, one of the officers who made the arrest.  It was one of the biggest and rarest narcotics hauls made by local police in city history.  Some of the 185 morphine, 100 codeine sulphate tablets, partly filled bottle of tincture of opium and 'hydrochloride powder' and hypodermic syringe, needle, eye dropper and burnt spoon found by the officers in the apartment later, are shown in the picture. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: King "Count" Frank, police officer Archie "Babyface" Palmer, and Inspector Lawrence Maloney behind table with drug paraphernalia, syringes and medicine bottles
